comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Karl Franz Joseph Ludwig Hubert Georg Otto Marie von Habsburg-Lothringen, AKA Charles I of Austria. (1887-1922) From Wikipedia: "Charles became heir-presumptive with the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand, his uncle, in Sarajevo in 1914, the event which precipitated World War I. Charles succeeded to the thrones in November 1916, when his grand-uncle, Franz Josef I of Austria died. Charles also became a Generalfeldmarschall in the Austro-Hungarian Army." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_I_of_Austria Also, see Flickr Commons Project notes under: and

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/2009631749/ is the same photograph from another (apparently French) source. This one has been cataloged, with the summary: "Print shows Archduke Charles François Joseph (later Emperor of Austria), and his aide-de-camp Count Van der Straten-Ponthoz, sitting in an automobile with driver and another officer."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A Count Robert van der Straten-Ponthoz was Belgian Ambassador to the United States from 1935 to 1945. It could be the same man, since he looks quite young here. books.google.com/books?id=jkoEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA60&lp... shows the ambassador (photo at top left). I'd say the noses are compatible.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Using the LOC's attribution, (look further down the page of your LOC cite), it's Count Rudolf van der Straten-Ponthoz (1877-1961), member of a noble Austrian family that had both a Belgian and Austrian branch, explained here: de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Van_der_Straten-Ponthoz The source of the other LOC copy of this is : www.loc.gov/pictures/item/2005690951/ His father had the same name, and perhaps it is the earlier count pictured: www.genealogieonline.nl/en/west-europese-adel/I1073885455...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @artolog,  With some more digging, I had come to the same conclusion, that it was Rudolf.  Thanks for the group link.  I see that several more of the Bain photos come from the same group?  Presumably Bain and LoC both got copies of the same set of pictures.  I'll make some more links.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: It's interesting that this and some of the same duplicates are shot from printed sources, not photographs.  Bain must have been copying a publication of some kind for these.
